publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3639 Jack McConnell: Congratulations to GALVmed—That the Parliament welcomes the pioneering work that Scottish charity the Global Alliance for Livestock Veterinary Medicines (GALVmed) is engaged in to make affordable livestock vaccines available to some of the world’s poorest livestock keepers in many of the Commonwealth states; recognises that for millions of people, in many Commonwealth states, livestock ownership provides a way to escape absolute poverty, and welcomes friends from overseas who will attend the celebration on 11 March 2009 of the 10th anniversary of the Commonwealth Parliamentary Association including two members of the Maasai community from northern Tanzania.

S3M-3639 Congratulations to GALVmed (lodged on 6 March 2009) James Kelly*, Jamie McGrigor*, Kenneth Gibson*, Jackie Baillie*, Liam McArthur*, Patricia Ferguson*, Sarah Boyack*, Patrick Harvie*, Bill Butler*, David Whitton*, Trish Godman*, Ross Finnie*, Robin Harper*
S3M-3639 Congratulations to GALVmed (lodged on 6 March 2009) Karen Whitefield*, Jamie Hepburn*, Marilyn Livingstone*
S3M-3639 Congratulations to GALVmed (lodged on 6 March 2009) Mary Mulligan*, Hugh Henry*, Rhoda Grant*
S3M-3639 Congratulations to GALVmed (lodged on 6 March 2009) Stuart McMillan*, Gil Paterson*
S3M-3639 Congratulations to GALVmed (lodged on 6 March 2009) Cathy Peattie*
S3M-3639 Congratulations to GALVmed (lodged on 6 March 2009) Ken Macintosh*
